sidebar:
## Sidebar (Virtual Lab Interface)

A compact vertical sidebar on the left side of the screen serves as the main navigation panel. It includes:

### Top Section
- Shows the current navigation path (e.g., `Virtual Lab > Test 2`).

### Main Area
- Displays the current virtual lab title.
- Button for accessing **Documentation**.
- Optional buttons based on context, such as:
  - **About the Platform**
  - **Legal Information**

### Bottom Section
- **Home**: Returns to `/app/virtual-lab/`
- **Help**: General and legal info
- **User Account**: Access to profile and logout

The sidebar is icon-driven and minimal to ensure a clean interface.
general:
## General Overview

A project management platform for data science and research teams. It features:
- A dark blue professional interface with sidebar navigation
- Tools for project organization, team management, and resource tracking
- Multi-project support with role-based access and credit-based resource allocation
- Areas for experimentation, analysis, and documentation

Designed to support simulations, research workflows, and collaborative work across the project lifecycle.
chat:
## AI Chat

A collapsible tab on the right provides access to the AI assistant. It can help users navigate the platform and access tools contextual to their tasks.
page_selection:
## Page Navigation Sidebar

Visible on all pages except **Explore**. This larger sidebar (to the right of the main one) allows navigation between:
- Home
- Library
- Team
- Activity
- Notebooks
- Explore
- Build
- Experiment
- Admin
home:
## Home Page

The project dashboard includes:
- Project title and editable description (top left)
- Metadata: creation date, admin info, credit balance
- Team collaboration section with visible avatars
- Blue gradient interface with aerial imagery
- Edit button in the top right to update project details
library:
## Library Page

Displays saved project entities across three tabs:
- **Experimental Data**
- **Models**
- **Simulations**
project_team:
## Project Team Page

Displays all members in the project. Admins can add or remove team members.
activity:
## Activity Page

Shows recent project activities in a table format. The default tab is **Memodel**, with additional tabs:
- Single Neuron Synaptome
- Single Neuron Simulation
- Single Neuron Synaptome Simulation

If no activity is found, a placeholder message is shown. Columns include:
- Scale
- Use Case
- Activity
- Name
- Status
- Date
- Actions

Designed for neuroscience simulation tracking in a scientific computing environment.
notebooks:
## Notebooks Page

Scientific data management for computational neuroscience. Features:

### Tabs
- **OBI Notebooks** (default)
- **Member Notebooks**

### Interface
- Search bar and filtering tools (6 active columns)
- Sortable table columns

### Table Columns
- Name
- Description
- Object of Interest (e.g., SingleCellSimulation, morphology)
- Scale (typically Cellular)
- Authors
- Creation Date

### Research Areas
- Electrophysiology
- Dendritic morphology
- Cell modeling
- Inhibitory neural activity

Clean, professional UI with chronological sorting (entries from July 2025)
.
explore:
## Explore Section

A 3D brain atlas interface focused on the **Cerebellum**, with no right-side page navigation sidebar. Features:

### Left Panel
- Hierarchical region selector (e.g., Brain Stem, Cerebrum, Cerebellum)
- Search for brain regions

### Main View
- Neuron count: ~41.7 million
- Toggle: **Count** vs **Density**
- M-Types listed with neuron counts

### Right Panel
- 3D visualization: cerebellum highlighted in yellow
- Toggle: **Experimental Data** / **Model Data**

### Bottom Section
- Data records:
  - Morphology: 50
  - Electrophysiology, Neuron density, Synapse data: 0

Admin:
## Admin Page

Project management dashboard with collapsible tabs.

### Costs Tab (Expanded)
- Activity log with columns:
  - Activity (e.g., Simulate)
  - Scale (e.g., Single Cell)
  - User
  - Date
  - Credits used
- Shows simulation activity over time
- Top-right stats: Reserved credits and credit balance

### Danger Zone Tab (Expanded)
- Contains a **Delete Project** button (red)
- Minimal layout to focus on the action

### UI Pattern
- Accordion-style tabs with plus/minus icons
- Blue theme, red accents for destructive actions
- Clean tabular data presentation
